recipe.title: Making Vietnamese Rainbow Dessert
recipe.introduction: This dessert is a childhood treat for many Vietnamese people. Its creamy, refreshing, and sweet taste can help you defeat the summer heat. Its various ingredients create a fun texture in your mouth upon consumption. The ingredients take between 2 and 3 hours to prepare but assembling the dessert only takes a few minutes. Let’s get into it!

ingredientList.description: Most ingredients can be found in any Asian market.
ingredientList.ingredient: 2 tbsp of agar-agar powder It’s often sold in a small packet of 0.88 oz in Asian markets.

preparation.description: The preparation is divided by each component of the dish.

component.name: Pandan leaves
component.description: Pandan leaves are used for flavoring and coloring.

steps.step: Wash the leaves then finely chop them.
Blend the leaves with 2 cups of water until fully mixed.
Filter the mixture through a sieve and cheesecloth.
Set aside ½ cup of the pandan juice for coloring.
Mix the blended pandan leaves with 2 cups of warm water.
Filter the mixture again to get roughly 4 cups of pandan juice.

component.name: Carrot and Beetroot
component.description: These two vegetables are used for natural color. They should be processed individually. You will have two cups of red and orange juice for later steps.

steps.step: Wash and peel the vegetables.
Cut them into small pieces for blending.
Blend each of them separately with ½ cup of water.
Filter the blended mixture with a sieve and cheesecloth.

component.name: Agar-agar powder
component.description: This section uses a part of the product from preparing the pandan leaves. The result will be pandan jelly and coconut jelly.

steps.step: Soak half of the agar-agar (1 tbsp) into pandan juice for 20 minutes.
Cook the pandan agar-agar on medium heat while stirring constantly.
Reduce the heat to low when the mixture starts boiling.
Add 5 tbsp of sugar, stir until the sugar dissolves, then turn off the heat.
Pour the agar-agar into a mold and let it cool down completely before putting it into the fridge.
Soak the remaining agar-agar (the last 1 tbsp) in the coconut juice for 20 minutes.
Cook the coconut agar-agar the same way as the pandan one. You can save time by soaking the agar-agar in coconut juice before cooking the pandan mixture.
Once the agar-agar is set, cut or shred it into preferred shapes.

component.name: Water chestnuts
component.description: Before processing the chestnuts, you will need the coloring juices from pandan leaves, carrot, and beetroot.

steps.step: Wash, peel, and dice the water chestnuts into small bits. If you use canned water chestnuts, they are already peeled.
Split the water chestnuts into 3 even parts.
Add 1 tbsp of sugar into each part and mix thoroughly.
Color each part in red, orange, and green by adding beetroot juice, carrot juice, and pandan juice.
Soak the water chestnut for 15 minutes until the chestnut bits turn into their new color.
Remove the water chestnut from the dye bath. Keep the colored juices.
Mix each part of water chestnut with tapioca flour to fully coat the small cubes in a thin layer of flour. Remove the excessive flour.
Boil the red chestnut cubes in 1.5 cups of water and the leftover beetroot juice. Stir lightly so they don’t stick to each other.
When the cubes float up, remove them and soak them in an ice bath for 5 minutes.
After 5 minutes, take the cubes out and let them dry. The result should be distinctively red chestnut bits wrapped in a translucent layer of red tapioca.
Repeat the boiling, soaking, and drying processes with the orange and green water chestnut cubes.
steps.note: Fun fact: The red water chestnut cubes are the main reason this dish gets the name “Pomegranate Dessert” in Vietnamese because they resemble pomegranate seeds when cooked.

component.name: Mung bean
component.description: The mung bean paste will add a touch of creaminess to the dessert.

steps.step: Wash the mung beans then soak them in warm water for 1 hour.
Pour mung beans into a pot and add water until reaching 1 inch above the bean’s surface.
Cook the beans on medium heat until boiled.
Remove white bubbles on the surface and excessive water, leaving the beans barely submerged.
Cover the lid and cook for 20 minutes on low heat until the mung bean is softened and can be mashed with a spoon.
While it’s still hot, add ½ cup of coconut milk, 1.5 tbsp of sugar, and a pinch of salt.
Mash the mung bean mixture on extremely low heat until it becomes a smooth paste.

component.name: Coconut milk
component.description: Coconut milk is the base that binds all the ingredients together when assembling the dessert.

steps.step: Add 1 cup of coconut milk, ¾ cup of sugar, and a pinch of salt into a pot.
Mix them on low heat until well combined.
Remove from heat and let cool completely.

assembly.description: All components should be either at room temperature or fridge temperature.

steps.step: All components of the dish should be either at room temperature or fridge temperature.
Add shaved ice into a bowl.
Add water chestnut cubes, coconut and pandan jelly, then mung bean paste on top of the ice. Spread them around the bowl.
Pour a preferred amount of coconut milk on top.

assembly.conclusion: And voilà! You’ve successfully made a fun and refreshing Vietnamese dish - the Rainbow Dessert (or “Jelly and Pomegranate chè” in Vietnamese).
